title: Saratoga County Airport
text:
Saratoga County Airport is a county-owned, public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> located three <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (6 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) southwest of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Saratoga%20Springs%2C%20New%20York">Saratoga Springs</a>, a city in <a href="Saratoga%20County%2C%20New%20York">Saratoga County, New York</a>, United States. It is included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Facilities and aircraft.
Saratoga County Airport covers an area of 300 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (121 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 433 feet (132 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has two <a href="runway">runway</a>s with <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> and <a href="concrete">concrete</a> surfaces: 5/23 is 4,699 by 100 feet (1,432 x 30 m); 14/32 is 4,000 by 100 feet (1,219 x 30 m). Jet aircraft use runways 5 or 23.
For the 12-month period ending August 29, 2008, the airport had 38,550 aircraft operations, an average of 105 per day: 96% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>, 4% <a href="air%20taxi">air taxi</a>, and <1% <a href="military%20aviation">military</a>. At that time there were 62 aircraft based at this airport: 63% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a>, 26% <a href="glider%20%28sailplane%29">glider</a>, 8% multi-engine, 2% <a href="jet%20aircraft">jet</a>, and 2% <a href="helicopter">helicopter</a>.
